intro: Riedeliella graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered riedeliella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
